panel.html:
Description: This dashboard offers a consolidated view of configurations and metrics which are of interest when troubleshooting HEC performance / ingestion issues. The goal is to provide insights into the Splunk HEC receiver group (HF or indexer) for identifying any bottlenecks in the platform.
Where to install: Install this view on the monitoring console instance inside the monitoring console app and make sure the hec receiver group instances are added to the monitoring console as distributed search peers with the server role of indexer. Custom group labels can be applied in the monitoring console setup to group the hec receivers if necessary. For assistance configuring the monitoring console: https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/DMC/Configureindistributedmode.

search.query: | rest /services/server/sysinfo splunk_server_group=dmc_group_indexer splunk_server_group=$dmc_group$ | join splunk_server [| rest /services/server/info splunk_server_group=dmc_group_indexer splunk_server_group=$dmc_group$] | table splunk_server version numberOfCores, numberOfVirtualCores physicalMemoryMB ulimits.open_files transparent_hugepages.effective_state | sort +splunk_server

| rest splunk_server_group=dmc_group_indexer splunk_server_group=$dmc_group$ /services/properties/inputs/http/disabled | search value=0 | rename value as disabled | join splunk_server [ | rest /services/properties/inputs/http/dedicatedIoThreads | rename value as dedicatedIoThreads] | join splunk_server [ | rest /services/properties/inputs/http/enableSSL | rename value as enableSSL] | join splunk_server [ | rest /services/properties/inputs/http/port | rename value as port] | join splunk_server [ | rest /services/properties/inputs/http/maxSockets | rename value as maxSockets] | join splunk_server [ | rest /services/properties/inputs/http/maxThreads | rename value as maxThreads] | eval stanza="http" | eval conf="inputs.conf"| fields splunk_server conf stanza maxSockets maxThreads dedicatedIoThreads enableSSL port disabled | sort +splunk_server

| rest splunk_server_group=dmc_group_indexer splunk_server_group=$dmc_group$ /services/data/inputs/http | search title!=*streamfwd | search disabled=0 | fields title | rename title as stanza | dedup stanza

| rest splunk_server_group=dmc_group_indexer splunk_server_group=$dmc_group$ /services/data/inputs/http | search title!=*streamfwd | eval conf="inputs.conf" | fields splunk_server conf title index indexes sourcetype token useACK disabled |eval useACK=if(isnull(useACK),0,useACK) | rename title as stanza | sort +splunk_server | search $stanza$

panel.html:
HttpInputDataHandler errors
Description: Identifies if there are any HttpInputDataHandler errors logged by the HEC reciever.

html.p: Recommended Action: Review the reply code sent back to the client to determine the nature of the error. To ensure data is successfully ingested into the Splunk platform, configure your clients with the ability to act on response codes returned by the HEC endpoint. If the client can't take an action based on the resulting response code, data loss might occur.
If no response to the client is logged enable DEBUG:

search.query: |search component=HttpInputDataHandler log_level!=INFO TERM(reply) NOT "reply: 0" | rex "handled token: (?<handled_token>\S+),\s+channel:\s+(?<handled_channel>\S+),\s+reply:\s+(?<handled_reply>\S+)," | eval reply=coalesce(reply,handled_reply) | eval channel = if(isnotnull(channel), channel, handled_channel) | eval handled_channel = if(isnotnull(handled_channel), handled_channel, "n/a") | eval channel=coalesce(channel,handled_channel) | eval token=coalesce(name,handled_token) | eval source_IP = if(isnotnull(source_IP), source_IP, "n/a") | eval response_to_client=case(reply=="0","success",reply=="1","Token disabled",reply=="2","Token is required",reply=="3","Invalid authorization",reply=="4","Invalid token",reply=="5","No data",reply=="6","Invalid data format",reply=="7","Incorrect index",reply=="9","Server is busy",reply=="10","Data channel is missing",reply=="11","Invalid data channel",reply=="12","Event field is required",reply=="13","Event field cannot be blank",reply=="14","ACK is disabled",reply=="15","Error in handling indexed fields",reply=="16","Query string authorization is not enabled",reply=="17","HEC is healthy",reply=="18","HEC is unhealthy, queues are full",reply=="19","HEC is unhealthy, ack service unavailable",reply=="20","Hec is unhealthy, queues are full, ack service unavailable") | table _time host log_level token channel reply source_IP response_to_client | stats count by host token reply source_IP response_to_client | stats list(source_IP) as source_IP list(reply) as reply list(response_to_client) as response_to_client list(count) as count by host token | sort +host | search $tk$

panel.html:
Maximum Physical Memory Usage Deployment-Wide
Description: Shows maximum physical memory usage percentage across all members of the selected group.

html.p: Recommended Action:Review Monitoring Console Resource Usage Instance views to determine the processes consuming the most memory.
Click chart for per host detail.

search.query: |search component=Hostwide | eval pct_mem_usage=(('data.mem_used' / 'data.mem') * 100), server=host | bin _time span=10s | stats latest(pct_mem_usage) as dedup_pct_mem_usage by server _time | timechart minspan=10s Max(dedup_pct_mem_usage) as pct_mem_usage | eval ceiling=100

panel.html:
Maximum Disk latency
Description: The average time (in milliseconds) for I/O requests issued to the device to be served. This includes the time spent by the requests in queue and the time spent servicing them.

html.p: Recommended Action: Use to review Disk latency. Ideal await times for any mount point where Splunk operates is under 10ms

search.query: |search component=IOstats data.avg_total_ms>0 "data.mount_point"=*| timechart minspan=10s limit=60 max(data.avg_total_ms) by host | eval ideal_latency=10

html.p: Click host to split by mount point.

search.query: |search host="$t4$" component=IOstats data.avg_total_ms>0 "data.mount_point"=*| timechart minspan=10s limit=60 max(data.avg_total_ms) by data.mount_point | eval ideal_latency=10

panel.html:
Channels
Description: A channel is a virtual connection Splunk maintains which is a tuple of source+sourcetype+host. More than
5k per ingest pipe or 10k total across all ingest pipes per Splunk instance can reduce ingestion thruput.

p.p: a.) Consider increasing parallel ingestion pipelines if more than 5k channels per ingest pipe but less than 10k per instance

b.) Increase inactive channels if more than 10k new_channels per instance in a 30s span. By increasing inactive channels we are building a larger cache of inactive channels which can be reused. This can increase thruput as channels live longer. This action is only effective when those input channels could have been reused: for example, the source, sourcetype, and host fields are not generated randomly and tend to be reused within the lifetime of cached channel entries

search.query: |search new_channels |timechart span=30s sum(new_channels) by host useother=f limit=0 | eval instance_channel_threshold=10000

chart.title: new channels per pipeline on instance: $t5$

search.query: |search host="$t5$" new_channels | eval ingest_pipeline= if(isnull(ingest_pipe),0,ingest_pipe) | timechart span=30s max(new_channels) by ingest_pipeline limit=0 useother=f | eval pipeline_channel_threshold=5000

panel.html:
Blocked Queues
Description: Identifies if there are any blocked queues by host and queue name. Blocked queues can lead to backpressure to the hec clients and result in data loss.

html.p: Recommended Action: Use the monitoring console Indexing>Performance>Instance to troubleshoot Splunk data processing queues.

search.query: | search group=queue blocked=true | eval host_name=host.":".name | timechart minspan=10s count by host_name useother=f limit=0

panel.html:
Throughput KB/s per Instance
Description: Measures total throughput in KB/s per HEC receiver instance.

html.p: Recommended Action: If throughput is greater than 20MB/s per HEC receiving instance (Heavy Forwarder), consider scaling horizontally by adding more heavy forwarders.

search.query: | search group=thruput name=thruput | timechart minspan=30s partial=f per_second(kb) AS kbps by host | eval kbps=round(kbps,0)
| tstats count WHERE (index!=_*) BY index | fields index
| tstats count WHERE ($index$) BY index _time $span$ prestats=t | timechart $span$ count by index

index=_introspection component="HttpEventCollector" "data.series"="http_event_collector_token" sourcetype=http_event_collector_metrics source=*/http_event_collector_metrics.log | dedup data.token_name | table data.token_name

b.span: Events per second by hec token

search.query: | search $token$ | timechart span=1m partial=f per_second(data.num_of_events) as eps by data.token_name usenull=f

html.b: sample config tuning on Splunk HEC receiver:

p.p: #4-8 but not more than # of cpu cores. Default 0 (uses single thread)
#increase if load balancer in front of hec receivers. Set busyKeepAliveIdleTimeout value higher than load balancer's idle timeout value

p.b: if HEC receiver is not using indexer acknowledgement (useACK = 0):

html.p: curl -k -H "Authorization: Splunk b5823516-1d22-4a7f-b6b3-74adb44da5ee" https://your-hec-receiver:8088/services/collector/event -d '{"sourcetype": "mysourcetype", "event": "sample hec event no ACK!"}'

p.b: if HEC receiver is using indexer acknowledgement (useACK = 1) you must supply a channel identifier:

html.p: curl -k -H "Authorization: Splunk b5823516-1d22-4a7f-b6b3-74adb44da5ee" -H "X-Splunk-Request-Channel: FE0ECFAD-13D5-401B-847D-77833BD77131" https://your-hec-receiver:8088/services/collector/event -d '{"sourcetype": "mysourcetype", "event": "sample hec event with ACKS"}'
